    •  Methods
      • Create a new PostmarkAdminClient.
        __construct()
      • Create a new Sender Signature for a given email address. Note that you will need to "verify" this Sender Signature by following a link that will be emailed to the "fromEmail" address specified when calling this method.
        createSenderSignature()
      • Create a new Server. Any parameters passed with NULL will be ignored (their default values will be used).
        createServer()
      • Delete a Sender Signature with the given ID.
        deleteSenderSignature()
      • Delete a Server used for sending/receiving mail. NOTE: To protect your account, you'll need to contact support and request that they enable this feature on your account before you can use this client to delete Servers.
        deleteServer()
      • Alter the defaults for a Sender Signature.
        editSenderSignature()
      • Modify an existing Server. Any parameters passed with NULL will be ignored (their existing values will not be modified).
        editServer()
      • Get information for a sepcific Sender Signature.
        getSenderSignature()
      • Request a given server by ID.
        getServer()
      • Get a "page" of Sender Signatures.
        listSenderSignatures()
      • Get a list of all servers configured on the account.
        listServers()
      • Cause a new DKIM key to be generated and associated with the Sender Signature. This key must be added to your email domain's DNS records. Including DKIM is not required, but is recommended. For more information on DKIM and its purpose, see http://www.dkim.org/
        requestNewSenderSignatureDKIM()
      • Cause a new verification email to be sent for an existing (unverified) Sender Signature.
        resendSenderSignatureConfirmation()
      • Request that the Postmark API updates verify the SPF records associated with the Sender Signature's email address's domain. Configuring SPF is not required to use Postmark, but it is highly recommended, and can improve delivery rates.
        verifySenderSignatureSPF()

    • \
    • Postmark
    • \PostmarkAdminClient

    The PostmarkAdminClient allows users to access and modify "Account-wide" settings. At this time the API supports management of the "Sender Signatures", and "Servers."

    package Postmark-PHP
    inherited_from \Postmark\PostmarkClientBase

     Methods

    Create a new PostmarkAdminClient.

    __construct($account_token) 

    :param string $account_token: The Account Token used to access the Admin API. This token is NOT the same as a Server Token. You can get your account token from this page: https://postmarkapp.com/account/edit

    inherited_from \Postmark\PostmarkClientBase::__construct()

    Parameters

    $account_token

    Create a new Sender Signature for a given email address. Note that you will need to "verify" this Sender Signature by following a link that will be emailed to the "fromEmail" address specified when calling this method.

    createSenderSignature($fromEmail, $name, $replyToEmail = NULL) 

    :param string $fromEmail: :param string $name: :param string $replyToEmail: :rtype: DynamicResponseModel

    Parameters

    $fromEmail

    $name

    $replyToEmail

    Create a new Server. Any parameters passed with NULL will be ignored (their default values will be used).

    createServer($name, $color = NULL, $rawEmailEnabled = NULL, $smtpApiActivated = NULL, $inboundHookUrl = NULL, $bounceHookUrl = NULL, $openHookUrl = NULL, $postFirstOpenOnly = NULL, $trackOpens = NULL, $inboundDomain = NULL, $inboundSpamThreshold = NULL) 

    :param string $name: :param string $color: The color shown for the server in the Postmark web UI (may be any of the following: purple, blue, turqoise, green, red, yellow, grey) :param bool $rawEmailEnabled: :param bool $smtpApiActivated: :param string $inboundHookUrl: :param string $bounceHookUrl: :param string $openHookUrl: :param bool $postFirstOpenOnly: :param bool $trackOpens: :param string $inboundDomain: :param integer $inboundSpamThreshold Between 0 and 30. :rtype: DynamicResponseModel

    Parameters

    Delete a Sender Signature with the given ID.

    deleteSenderSignature($id) 

    :param integer $id: :rtype: DynamicResponseModel

    Parameters

    $id

    Delete a Server used for sending/receiving mail. NOTE: To protect your account, you'll need to contact support and request that they enable this feature on your account before you can use this client to delete Servers.

    deleteServer($id) 

    :param integer $id: The ID of the Server to delete. :return DynamicResponseModel

    Parameters

    $id

    Modify an existing Server. Any parameters passed with NULL will be ignored (their existing values will not be modified).

    editServer($id, $name = NULL, $color = NULL, $rawEmailEnabled = NULL, $smtpApiActivated = NULL, $inboundHookUrl = NULL, $bounceHookUrl = NULL, $openHookUrl = NULL, $postFirstOpenOnly = NULL, $trackOpens = NULL, $inboundDomain = NULL, $inboundSpamThreshold = NULL)

    Get a list of all servers configured on the account.

    listServers($count = 100, $offset = 0, $name = NULL) 

    :param integer $count: The number of servers to retrieve in the request, defaults to 100. :param integer $offset: The number of servers to "skip" when paging through lists of servers. :param string $name: :rtype: DynamicResponseModel

    Parameters

    $count

    $offset

    $name

    Cause a new DKIM key to be generated and associated with the Sender Signature. This key must be added to your email domain's DNS records. Including DKIM is not required, but is recommended. For more information on DKIM and its purpose, see http://www.dkim.org/

    requestNewSenderSignatureDKIM($id) 

    :param integer $id: :rtype: DynamicResponseModel

    Parameters

    $id

    Cause a new verification email to be sent for an existing (unverified) Sender Signature.

    resendSenderSignatureConfirmation($id) 

    Sender Signatures require verification before they may be used to send email through the Postmark API.

    :param integer $id: :rtype: DynamicResponseModel

    Parameters

    $id

    Request that the Postmark API updates verify the SPF records associated with the Sender Signature's email address's domain. Configuring SPF is not required to use Postmark, but it is highly recommended, and can improve delivery rates.

    verifySenderSignatureSPF($id) 

    :param integer $id: :rtype: DynamicResponseModel

    Parameters

    $id

     Properties

     

    BASE_URL is "https://api.postmarkapp.com"

    $BASE_URL 

    Default

    "https://api.postmarkapp.com"
    Static

    You may modify this value to disable SSL support, but it is not recommended. :var string:
